greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Glaisher's chi_12(n).
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from G. C. Greubel)
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q * f(-x^2)^24 * phi(q)^2 * (chi(q)^24 - 92*q + 16*q^2 / chi(q)^24) in powers of q where phi(), chi(), f() are Ramanujan theta functions.

a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = (-64)^e, a(p^e) = p^(6*e) * (1 + (-1)^e)/2 if p == 3 (mod 4), a(p^e) = a(p) * a(p^(e-1)) - p^12 * a(p^(e-2)) if p == 1 (mod 4) where a(p) = 2 * Re( (x + i*y)^12 ) and p = x^2 + y^2 with even x. - _Michael Somos_, Nov 18 2014
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (4 t)) = 2^13 (t/i)^13 f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ q EllipticTheta[3, 0, q]^2 QPochhammer[ q^2]^24 (QPochhammer[ -q, q^2]^24 - 92 q + 16 q^2/QPochhammer[ -q, q^2]^24), {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(r); if( n<1, 0, r = sqrtint(n); sum( x=-r, r, sum( y=-r, r, if( x^2 + y^2 == n, (x + I*y)^12) )) / 4 ) };

(PARI) {a(n) = local(A, p, e, x, y, z, a0, a1); if( n<0, 0, A = factor(n); prod( k=1, matsize(A)[1], if( p=A[k, 1], e = A[k, 2]; if( p==2, (-64)^e, if( p%4 == 3, if( e%2, 0, p^(6*e)), forstep( i=0, sqrtint(p), 2, if( issquare( p - i^2, &y), x = i; break)); a0 = 1; a1 = x = real( (x + I*y)^12 ) * 2; for( i=2, e, y = x*a1 - p^12*a0; a0=a1; a1=y); a1))))) }; /* _Michael Somos_, Nov 18 2014 */
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Nov 16 2014
